context: Im a big fan of Thomas Covenant novels. What do you think?

Well, the first of the trilogy would be ".The Chronicles of Thomas covenant, the Unbeliever". That's where he first began.
Huh. I dont know much about any of them. What was it about?
Well, Thomas covenant was a cynical and bitter writer, he was shunned because he had leprosy. But, in this alternate world, he would become the hero of The Land.
Very interesting. What exactly is Leprosy and did it affect his writing in any way?
Well, this was in the book, and the 6 novels between 1977 and 83, he was in a constant battle with Lord Foul, who wanted to hurt and demolish his enemy, "The Creator".
I think I would enjoy reading those novels.
output: i think lord foul's bane is a great fantasy novel. it's a great read.

context: Hi there, I'm a parent to 3 beautiful children. It's more difficult than people think. Are you a parent?
Yes, I have two wonderful children myself. I try to be a good parent, but it can be difficult to know if the decisions you make are the right ones, can't it?
Definitely! Especially with social media the way it is nowadays. Everyone seems to have a different opinion or likes to criticize every single decision we make.
I totally agree. Most people just don't realize that being a parent goes beyond the biological aspects of it, and there is much more to raising a child than that. There are always critics!

Exactly, and the older children get the more they are exposed to the real world before I'm actually ready for them to see it. My daughter was asking for an Iphone at 5 years old. Cell phones weren't even around when I was that age.
Me either! Not to mention that beyond the social media, there is even the government and society that tries to add their two sense to your parenting decisions.

I just can't believe the news headlines sometimes. I remember one that shocked me. It was child services trying to take a ladies two children away because they walked to the park in their own neighborhood alone. My siblings and I used to spend the entire day at the park by ourselves when were that age.
We did too! We went outside. I feel sorry for children without parents, living in foster care, that's very sad.
It's horrible. The numbers just keep rising. Becoming a foster parent is very high on my list. I just hurt for those children so much.
output: i agree. it's sad that the government is placing children in foster care.
reference: Well it helps to have family to help too

context: Can you give me more information about a divorce?
Sure! Divorce is essentially the termination of a marriage between two people.

Typically you want to talk to lawyer but it really varies considerably around the world.
How long have people been getting divorced?
I'm not sure, but the reasons can vary from sexual incompatibility to lack of independence.
Do you have any statistics about divorce?
output: i'm not sure, but divorce laws vary considerably around the world, but in most countries divorce requires the sanction of a court or other authority in a
reference: Not exactly, but one thing that people seem to confuse divorce with is annulment, which declares the marriage null and void.

context: I've always been interested in American literature.  I find the culture and writing styles very different from other countries.  Are you knowledgeable in American literature?
I know that it began in America as part of the broader tradition of English literature.  It is greatly influenced by English Literature.
For example, it's influenced by Shakespeare and various writers from his time?  If so, what is the difference between American literature and English literature?
I believe it was very similar until the late 18th and early 19th centuries when the nation's first novels were published.  These writings were more unique for American Literature.
What were the novels called that were published?  I would be interested to read them to see what difference between the two.
An early example from 1791 is William Hill Brown's "The Power of Sympathy" which is a love story between siblings that fall in love not knowing they are related.  Pretty controversial, right???
Sounds weirdly incestuous.  What other books have been written to shape the American literature?
The newer literary figures that produced uniquely American Literature are Washington Irving and Edgar Allan Poe.
What works have they completed?
output: william hill brown's "the power of sympathy" was published in 1791.
reference: Edgar Allen Poe produced “The Fall of the House of Usher,” “The Masque of the Red Death,” and “Ligeia”.  Those would be a great start.

context: Hi, I am worried about my family getting cancer.  Do you know someone who has or had cancer?
Yes, I know several people who have had cancer. There are over 100 different types of cancers that can affect people. It is very scary indeed.
Wow, that is a lot. What are the easier cancers to treat?
I think one of the best things we can do for our children to help prevent HPV cancer is to make sure they get the vaccine. It can protect them in up to 9 types of HPV cancer.
How prevalent do you think HPV is in children?

It's not a childhood cancer, but they can get the vaccine early (age 12 maybe) to prevent HPV which is an infection that can cause cancer. So it's a cancer that happens later in life but can be prevented early on
Oh, okay. What are some ways to prevent cancers in general if possible?
I think generally, eat healthy, exercise, avoid drinking too much alcohol and not smoking are a good place to start
What is the most common type of cancer treatment?
output: i am not sure, but i do know that two in five people will have cancer at some point in their lifetime
reference: It depends on the type of cancer, but some treatments could be surgery or chemotherapy, possibly radiation. It all depends on the stage of the cancer.

context: Trucks seem like a useful vehicle to have

context: Ive been suffering from a mental disorder recently but I really dont understand it too much, do you have any insight on this?

context: I am so grateful for animal shelters - the no-kill ones. Those poor wee creatures - how could anyone abandon them?!
They usually take all kinds, stray, lost, abandoned or surrendered and sometimes sick or wounded wildlife.  Our local shelter is a no-kill one.
We have one here in our county, too. Haven't been able to visit as I have a temporary disability, but used to go to one where I lived in CA. It was very well run. Is your shelter large?
Ours is a pretty good size, my girls have volunteered there quite a bit and they will even have some sick tropical animals from time to time.
That is so wonderful. My neighbors just adopted an adorable dog from our place. She seems to be a lab-Dalmatian mix.
I'm glad to live in a state that has the Georgia Animal Protection Act - it was in response to inhumane treatment of animals at a pet chain store here in Atlanta.
Good for Georgia. I wish North Carolina would do the same. Anyone caught abusing an animal should go to jail, imho. Now I want to go to the shelter!
output: i'm glad that the us has no government-run organization that provides oversight of the various shelters on a national basis.
reference: I'm really glad they don't call them pounds any more - we've adopted all of our dogs from a shelter or a rescue.  I'll never buy another animal

context: Pit bulls are great dogs, but quite often they are misunderstood.
I have always wondered where the name pit bull came from as a name of a breed of dog.
Pit bulls are a descendant of bulldogs! Maybe that's where the "bull" comes from. What do you think?
Pit Bulls were originally developed as fighting dogs, so i'm sure that is how they received their reputation.
They do sometimes serve as search and rescue and police dogs, so they do have a purpose. I have friends that own them and they are wonderful pets if trained correctly.
output: i agree, they are great for hunting and driving livestock. they are also great for police work.
reference: I'm not certain that i would own one as a pet, but they have been used in the modern era as farm dogs to drive cattle or other livestock.
